page.title: 16TOURISM
page.content: Marbury is a small rural community with attractive meres and an ancient church.The Shropshire Union Canal (Llangollen Branch) divides the area, resulting in many tourists visiting the village,particularly during the summer months.Surveys were organized to extract useful information from the tourists.A printed questionnaire put in church from, 23_5_85 to 15-7-85, produced the following information. {Mode of transport.}Canal boat was nearly twice as popular as car,54_28. Other modes of transport included, motor cycle,motor caravan,train,foot and aeroplane. {Group size.}Parties of two,three and six were popular but parties of four were the most popular. {Home base of visitors.}Good spread over England _ Fourteen counties not represented were farthest away from
